td.content: My Disabilities, impairments and other Conditions

paragraph.content: Does the person suffer from a life-threatening or long-term condition?

td.paragraph: Road Traffic accident 6 months previously, resulting in fractured hip and shoulder

No problem / need
Rachel has been deaf from childhood

Is quite deaf, but is able to lip read well. It is therefore recommended that people speak slowly and clearly whilst facing the client. Using this technique was able to understand all of what was being said and appropriately respond verbally.

Medication reviewed in past year? Yes
Medication was reviewed recently by GP
Requires occasional assistance / performs with difficulty
Requires occasional assistance / performs with difficulty

During the assessment she appeared to be in good spirits. She was easy to engage in conversation and did not demonstrate any signs of cognitive impairment. Her attention and concentration appeared to be good and information provided by her about how she manages her ADLs proved to be accurate when checked against collateral history from her son.

paragraph.content: Lowering of Energy, drive and interest

Requires occasional assistance / performs with difficulty

Requires assistance of 1 person to perform activity

Requires assistance with personal care tasks. She doesn't like showering and finds it difficult to complete a wash (particularly lower limbs and feet). Also requires some assistance with getting dressed.
Does not / cannot perform activity / performed by another person
Family assist with domestic cleaning and shopping as required. Is at risk with her daily activities and routines as she is reliant on family for assistance with activities of daily living

td.content: Access to Education, Training and Employment

td.paragraph: Rachel not in currently in employment, and is happy with that.

COCD_TP146061UK02.Section1.title: Access to Education, Training and Employment

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Making a positive contribution

paragraph.content: Would the person like to be involved in more activities

td.paragraph: Has identified social isolation as an issue for her. currently unable to visit here mother which she used to do regularly.

td.content: My Religious, Cultural and Spiritual Needs

paragraph.content: No relevant issues raised during assessment.

td.paragraph: Financial management is assisted by son

text.paragraph: Whilst managing relatively well at home, does have difficulty with personal care and has also identified social isolation as an issue for her. Reports that her son would be happy for her to live with him, however, she would like to remain independent and living in her home for as long as possible. Is happy to accept a care package to assist with this aim.
Meets FACS criteria at Substantial risk to independence due to poor mobility, falls risk and inability to manage personal care independently.

paragraph.content: Summary of Strengths and Protective Factors

text.paragraph: Is willing to accept a care package to assist her to remain living at home independently. In addition, she has a supportive family who are willing to assist her as required.

text.paragraph: Financial assessment request form completed. To be submitted to Benefits and Assessment Team.
Care plan to be completed and care package commissioned with care brokers. Plan to include accessible transport.
Contact Mr Walters at home next week to offer / arrange assessment
